general.study_notes: a deterministic time trend is included as a variable.

model_notes.model_1: impulse responses to a monetary policy shock in the four-variable VAR with no time dependence.
model_notes.model_2: impulse responses from a VAR with time dependence. The response of variables to a monetary policy shock varies depending on the quarter in which the shock takes place; the shock takes place in quarter 1.
model_notes.model_3: impulse responses from a VAR with time dependence. The response of variables to a monetary policy shock varies depending on the quarter in which the shock takes place; the shock takes place in quarter 2.
model_notes.model_4: impulse responses from a VAR with time dependence. The response of variables to a monetary policy shock varies depending on the quarter in which the shock takes place; the shock takes place in quarter 3.
model_notes.model_5: impulse responses from a VAR with time dependence. The response of variables to a monetary policy shock varies depending on the quarter in which the shock takes place; the shock takes place in quarter 4.
model_notes.model_6: impulse responses from four-variable VARs with no time dependence in which the GDP deflator is replaced with nominal average hourly earnings of production workers in the total private, private manufacturing, and private service-providing sectors.
model_notes.model_7: impulse responses from four-variable VARs with no time dependence in which the GDP deflator is replaced with compensation per hour in the nonfinancial corporate sector.
